page.title: 04COUNTRY CARNIVAL.
page.content: On Saturday 15th June there was a country carnival at{the Vicarage.}A variety of{stalls}raised Â£900. There was also a{fancy dress competition with people dressed in the costumes of a number of different countries. My class took part in a{tug-of-war against children from{Kirbie Kendal {School}while Morris men and Lady dancers performed throughout the afternoon. Some people volunteered to go in the stocks to have wet sponges thrown at them. There was also a{Punch {and Judy show}and a man demonstrating how to shoe a horse. Another showed how to make a dry stone wall. There was one stall selling carved walking sticks, another had animals made out of cotton wool and a third, a selection of ornate candles. Sweets were on sale at Second World War prices.
